episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the cleanliness habits of badgers, the surprising crossover between Disney ride design and military technology, Stephen King's unique approach to audiobooks, and historical uses of bees in warfare.

facts.fact: My fact this week is that badgers change their bedding more often than I do.
My fact is that the chief designer of America's first stealth bomber also helped to design the Dumbo ride at Disneyland.

My fact this week is that whenever Stephen King couldn't find the audiobook of something he wanted to read, he would put one of his three children into a room with a tape recorder and would get them to read out the whole thing for him.
Okay, my fact this week is that in the 14th century, a weapon was invented that was essentially a windmill which flung out beehives from each of its arms.
